info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 06 at 3:18AM EDT until August 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 102. * WHERE...Northern Delaware, and parts of New Jersey and southeastern Pennsylvania. * WHEN...Until 8:00 PM Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity levels will increase the threat of heat related health issues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak heat index values are forecast to approach 100 today and they are expected to reach 100 to 102 on Sunday. Low temperatures should favor the 70s, providing little relief from the heat at night.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned location, stay out of the sun when possible, and check on elderly relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in a vehicle under any circumstance. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or late evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. To reduce your risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in a shaded or air conditioned environment. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
